definition: to step forward bravely
straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The only people who have sought physically to stop this dumping are Somali pirates.
sentences.chinese: 唯一挺身而出阻止这种倾倒行为的人是索马里海盗。

sentences.english: Zhang Xun , instead of following suit , fought bravely with the rebel army.
sentences.chinese: 张巡却挺身而出，勇敢地抗击叛军。

sentences.english: Had Dong Cunri not belt the cat, our troop would have suffered much more.
sentences.chinese: 如果董存瑞没有挺身而出，我们的队伍将损失更大。

sentences.english: Stepped forward determinedly, Mr. Johnson looked at the long road ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生望着面前漫长的道路毅然挺身而出。

sentences.english: I ask the Minister of Ethnic Affairs Pansy Wong to stand up for the ethnic communities.
sentences.chinese: 请少数民族事务部黄部长为少数族裔利益挺身而出。

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson looked at the long road ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生望着面前漫长的道路毅然挺身而出。

sentences.english: In the thin ring desire to harm someone rises, stand up suddenly stop zishu emphasize.
sentences.chinese: 在细响欲出手加害上升时，子书突然挺身而出阻止。

sentences.english: Allardyce, however, was quick to leap to the 25-year-old's defence.
sentences.chinese: 阿勒代斯挺身而出来捍卫这名25岁的球员。

sentences.english: More nations have stepped forward to maintain international peace and security.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的国家挺身而出，维护国际和平与安全。

definition: calamity
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
dying (from illness)/facing death/on one's deathbed
urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
to give one's life
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
desperate straits
to rise vigorously/a spirited start
the critical moment/life and death crisis
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
powerful enemy
isolated and without help
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
